intro: Soldanella × transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian sandwort, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
